website_summaries.verdict: Provides a good level of protection for many different DSLR models, all at a desirable price point.
pros: Offers zippers on the bottom of the rain cover so you can use it more easily when attached to a tripod
Adjustable Velcro straps allow the protective cover to work with camera lenses of different sizes
Thick and tough materials that keep the camera nicely protected
Uses sleeves so you can reach buttons and dials
cons: May be too bulky for some people, especially if you're hand-holding the camera

customer_reviews.title: Nice product, just not for me
customer_reviews.text: This rain cover is really nice if you don't need to extend the lens while it's raining. I used this once in Iceland, but it just did not work out for me. It kept everything nice and dry but is very bulky and difficult to adjust the focal length of the lens.
customer_reviews.author: Mikayla Moors

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the camera dry.
customer_reviews.text: This does well at keeping the camera dry, but it's a bit bigger than what I would like for my Nikon D90. The first time I used it was on the Oregon coast on a very cold, windy, wet day. I was thankful that my hands were able to stay dry as well. Since it was a bit big for my camera I had to be careful to adjust it so that the cover did not get in front of the lens. All in all a good product, and it sure beats the home made version I was using with a cut out hole in a zip lock bag!
customer_reviews.author: Joey W

customer_reviews.title: Works well!
customer_reviews.text: A bit awkward to use w/ a strap but after a bit I got the hang of it. Spent 3 hours in misting rain and drizzle last week and the D3200 camera stayed dry, pictures came out fine. Folds up to next to nothing and fits, along w/ my raincoat, in a belt pouch. Good inexpensive protection.
customer_reviews.author: Ric P.

customer_reviews.title: Worked well in Iceland
customer_reviews.text: Worked very well on a recent trip to Iceland. Kept the camera and 24-105 lens dry as long as everything was closed. The cameraman easy to operate with this cover on. The person I was rooming with is ordering one after seeing mine in use.
customer_reviews.author: GLH2576

customer_reviews.title: Good for traveling
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for traveling to wet areas! I've been through ice, snow, and rain with this and it protected my camera from getting wet. The downside is that moisture kinda gets on the clear part of the camera cover on the inside because the camera cover is too big for my Nikon D3400. Besides that, I do get compliments from other people with cameras, as they don't have any camera cover.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Luong

customer_reviews.title: Get Rain coat for your camera
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE IT! It's made with durable plastic and vinyl material. If you're using a zoom Lens like my 70 to 200 it fit fine. a short lens like my 50mm It took some maneuvering but I was able to scrunch up the part that goes around the lens to get the shot. The velcro won't wrap around it though because it's too small.
customer_reviews.author: Lexe B

customer_reviews.title: It does what the company says it will do
customer_reviews.text: Took this to Alaska and we got drenched, but my Canon 6D and 7D Mark II didn't. Simple solution to a problem - rain. Easy to manipulate and while a plastic rear window is less than ideal, not sure how you get around that with any current solution. I used this product to take photos from a fast moving Zodiac in rain and no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Brad E

customer_reviews.title: Very useful DSLR rain cover.
customer_reviews.text: Protects my DSLR from rain, but humidity fogs the clear panel. Have to wipe with a towel. Entry points secured by zipper or pull strings with spring clips. Well made.
customer_reviews.author: Gary V

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had much chance to use the rain cover this summer, but worked great when it was needed. Doesn't take up much room in the camera bag but it is nice to know it is there. I am sure it will get more use this fall and winter.
customer_reviews.author: Milton E. Anglin

customer_reviews.title: I intend to use it more in snow than rain because you can get some beautiful shots of snow falling without getting snow on your
customer_reviews.text: Works as described, no problems. I intend to use it more in snow than rain because you can get some beautiful shots of snow falling without getting snow on your camera. I use a Nikon d3400 with 18-55, 55-200 and 70-300 lenses.
customer_reviews.author: Mimie

customer_reviews.title: Good value, good service
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving a 4 star review because the. Endor's customer service is excellent and the cover will undoubtedly keep my camera dry. Keep in mind the lens extension has to best adjusted if you are not using a long lens. It is also a bit awkward until you practice with it, so make sure you do so before you need to use it.
customer_reviews.author: ASRAZ

customer_reviews.title: Helped my 5D Mark III survive Iceland!
customer_reviews.text: Used this for my trip to Iceland and it worked great. It was pretty rainy for 10 days straight and this didn't leak at all and allowed me to take beautiful pictures without getting water on the lens.
customer_reviews.author: honeybelle

customer_reviews.title: Kept Camera Dry
customer_reviews.text: Tried this out on Saturday in the pouring rain. Am very pleased with how it kept my camera dry and how easy it was to use my camera inside of it. The only thing I found was the clear plastic fogged up a little making it difficult to see through the viewfinder. An easy wipe solved that, though. Good product!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Tape and garbage bag work better.
customer_reviews.text: Fitment was terrible, impossible to use with a short lens. Very high chance of water pooling up. Absolutely worthless. Then when you get it to "fit", it slides off over your lens. Nope.
customer_reviews.author: red

customer_reviews.title: I suppose if you were using this on a tripod ...
customer_reviews.text: I suppose if you were using this on a tripod or somewhere you did not need to adjust focus it would work...doesn't not work well with my 70-200mm lens
customer_reviews.author: Laura Lux

customer_reviews.title: Best Bang for the Buck in wet weather camera covers
customer_reviews.text: Great cover for your camera. I purchased this to use with a Canon 5DmkII and a 70d. It fits both very well and prevents any moisture to get in the camera if you get caught in the rain. I showed it to a couple of friends of mine and they both immediately order one for their cameras. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Harley R.

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: Worked good to keep my camera from getting wet at Niagra falls
customer_reviews.author: Shelliensc

customer_reviews.title: Fit with the 300mm zoom lens attached
customer_reviews.text: This cover kept my DSLR and 300 mm zoom lens dry in the windy, rainy weather of Iceland. It was a little awkward getting used to but worked as I’d hoped. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: teresa

customer_reviews.title: Too bulky and awkward
customer_reviews.text: This was way too bulky and awkward to use. Gave up on it.
customer_reviews.author: STEVE WING

customer_reviews.title: and photography is his favorite hobby when we're on the road
customer_reviews.text: Hubby was very excited about this Christmas present. We travel quite a bit for pleasure, and photography is his favorite hobby when we're on the road. I'm excited about not having to hold an umbrella over his head and the camera for all those great shots!! haha!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Got your camera fully covered!
customer_reviews.text: Provides great protection and access to my Nikon D850 and lens.
customer_reviews.author: jtech

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use great value will keep my camera dry
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and does the job
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one. Perform as described. Even went under waterfall. Camera stayed dry.
customer_reviews.author: Marc Wormser

customer_reviews.title: Mirrorless camera: Large but works
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a mirrorless Fuji XT20 with a regular zoom lens. Works well at covering, but is a bit cumbersome given how much larger than the camera the cover is. However, I would recommend for the price.
customer_reviews.author: A D

customer_reviews.title: OK in a pinch
customer_reviews.text: I just find it hard to focus the lens and the velcro doesn't seem to keep it wrapped onto the lens properly.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn

customer_reviews.title: Great Rain Cover
customer_reviews.text: works great with my Nikkon D3300 camera. Used it in really rainy weather and camera stayed dry. Very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Deb S

customer_reviews.title: Protection is excellent, but I gave this cover four stars because ...
customer_reviews.text: I trust this thing so much that I took it straight into a massive water-balloon fight with a borrowed 7D Mark II and 70-200 IS f/2.8. Protection is excellent, but I gave this cover four stars because there is no eyecup for the viewfinder. The plastic fogs easily and doesn't run off water exceptionally well, so it can be tough to see your focal points in some circumstances. You're probably better off using live view in these situations if you have it -- touch screens are acceptably responsive through the plastic, even if they have a screen protector.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It works great, cheap, and as described! Definitely worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Hemminger

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Keeps the rain off on the Oregon Coast... That is why I bought it...
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: I expect they will do the job nicely.
customer_reviews.text: Bought to keep our cameras dry for our trip to Iceland. I expect they will do the job nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine.
customer_reviews.text: Have only used it a few times but my camera stayed dry so I’m happy. Window is big enough to see the display easily.
customer_reviews.author: shawn ray

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used it yet because it hasn't rained but the quality of the product is top notch
customer_reviews.author: Tyler dawson

customer_reviews.title: Rainy day life safer.
customer_reviews.text: This product saved my camera in rainy Iceland during a holiday trip.
customer_reviews.author: Charles D Gentle

customer_reviews.title: Best rain coat a dslr can ever get
customer_reviews.text: Fits like a glove for my gh4 and 18-35 sigma lens. Also tried it with the Canon 100-400 mm lens and i couldn't be happier with its performance during the rain. Totally worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Juan Paz

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time and seems to be made well. Have not used it in the rain yet
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Keep it dry!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this out several times to take storm photos. Works exactly as expected. It kept me able to operate my camera while keeping it safe in dry under a torrential rain with high winds.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Bolden

customer_reviews.title: Well constructed
customer_reviews.text: Well constructed. Arrived quickly. Fits my Canon Rebel T3. Have not had a chance to use in heavy rain yet. Will update my review once I do.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda E

customer_reviews.title: Yes it works
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and the other one. Same thing! If you have to shoot in the weather you have to have this.
customer_reviews.author: TinkermanTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Not a single drop of water.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for a rainy day and it was super helpful. Camera didn't got any drop of water on it.
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro

customer_reviews.title: OK
customer_reviews.text: Protected my camera at a holi festival with powder and water, but unfortunately my camera doesn't like working correctly when it is covered like that.
customer_reviews.author: Aren Cox

customer_reviews.title: Got this to protect my camera from moisture, I ...
customer_reviews.text: Got this to protect my camera from moisture, I have not used it a lot but it appears to be solidly built and will do the job when I need it.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Reali

customer_reviews.title: Not just for rain! Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Came in exactly as shown in the description. I'm using for filming cooking and this protects my Canon 7D II from grease and steam exposure.
customer_reviews.author: Blair A. Koss

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Fit!
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used it in the rain but looks the product looks very nice and seems like it would stand up to the down pour with no problem
customer_reviews.author: Wil71

customer_reviews.title: Was recommended on clickinmoms
customer_reviews.text: Just got this in the mail and can't wait to use it- genius product! Was recommended on clickinmoms.
customer_reviews.author: The Gardner Mama

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Although I just received it and have not used it yet, I was shocked by the quality of the materials used. For the price, I expected something to get me by until I found something better. However, this is made from a thicker nylon and thicker rubbery plastic window with a full length zipper to get the camera inside. I have no doubt this will serve its purpose on my annual trip to rainy Britain!
customer_reviews.author: Mschwizle

customer_reviews.title: Based on fit and apparent durability, it's a winner.  Time will tell.
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had the opportunity to use it yet, but I do want to take pictures on a dreary, foggy, rainy day to capture certain effects. It fits my Canon T6i perfectly and I'm just hoping it doesn't become a hinderance.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Rothberg

customer_reviews.title: Rain gear for camera
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Especially when it is used inside or when it is not wet outsided
customer_reviews.author: The Anaheim kid

customer_reviews.title: This is the best camera protector I've found
customer_reviews.text: Very well designed. This is the best camera protector I've found. You can get your hands on all the controls and the entire camera remains water tight.
customer_reviews.author: Warren Harris

customer_reviews.title: Looks well made
customer_reviews.text: Looks well made. Not had a. Vance tona tually try in weather yet.
customer_reviews.author: D. Somers

customer_reviews.title: but good quality
customer_reviews.text: Not much rain since I bought this, but good quality cover
customer_reviews.author: Sylvia B.

product_meta.title: Mudder Rain Cover Camera Protector Rainproof for Canon Nikon and Other Digital SLR Cameras
product_meta.description:
Camera Rain Cover Protector for Medium to Large DSLR Cameras 

Features: 

When suddenly caught by a rain shower, the rain Cover slips quickly over your camera and allows you to keep on shooting. 
The cover (black) is designed for medium to large SLR cameras. 
It can be access to all camera and lens controls via two side sleeves and a clear view through the transparent TPU window that enables easy monitoring all the time. 
It has a full length double zipper that provides bottom closure when held it by hand or put it on a tripod.
The interior adjustable straps help fit your lens to your adjustment.
feature_bullets: The rain cover protector is designed to protect your medium to large DSLR camera from any unexpected weather condition
It has a full length dual zipper that provides bottom closure when held it by hand or put it on a tripod
The adjustable straps help to fit your lens to your adjustment.
Compatible with Canon Rebel T5i T4i T3i T3 T2i T1i XS XSi XT XTi SL1, EOS 1100D 1000D 700D 650D 600D 550D 500D 450D 400D 350D 60D 60Da 50D 40D 30D 20D 20Da 7D DSLR cameras and more
Its thickness is unique, which can meet all your requirements

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars205 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
